gauzy: a gauzy texture is often very delicate and airy it may be found on fabrics like silk or cotton.
a gauzy surface is often shrouded in a delicate haze of morning fog or mist.
meshed: a meshed texture appears as a layered effect where individual threads or fibers are randomly intertwined with each other.
a meshed texture is a combination of many small threads or fibers of different materials woven together at different angles.
cracked: a cracked surface is often characterized by a dull and uneven appearance with visible fissures or cracks in the material.
cracked material appears as fragmented pieces that have broken apart due to stress and strain.
stratified: stratified material appears as layered sequence of different substances with varying textures and appearances.
stratified material appears as layers of different textures and colors, varying in thickness and composition, which can be seen under a microscope.
scaly: soft, velvety skin with wavy ridges and bumps often on the arms and legs.
scaly material appears as rough to the touch.
swirly: a swirly material is a mixture of air and tiny droplets of liquid in the air that can appear as a spiral or swirling pattern.
a swirly surface is characterized by its circular motion with no discernible boundaries or edges around it.
perforated: a perforated surface is characterized by a torn or damaged fabric with holes or tears that allow air or water to pass through gently.
a sound or sensation that is like a series of small holes or cracks in a surface, which can appear as a patchy or irregular texture that resembles a scattered or scattered pattern of tiny punctures.'
pleated: pleated material is a type of fabric with folds in the surface that can be found on trousers and other pants.
a pleated surface has folds that are layered and symmetrical and often wavy or rounded.
flecked: a flecked surface is one with small scattered particles or marks distributed randomly throughout the entire area.
flecked material appears as small patches of color on a background.
fibrous: fibrous materials appear as long thin stems or strings.
a fibrous surface is usually rough and irregular to the touch and often has a woody texture.
polka-dotted: the polka-dotted material is usually a brightly colored fabric with small black dots randomly scattered on it.
a polka-dot texture resembles small round dots scattered across fabric evenly.
chequered: a chequered texture is characterized by alternating stripes of different colors on a surface.
a chequered surface is typically characterized by multiple colors of fabric on one side or the other.
blotchy: blotchy material has an uneven texture and a mottled appearance.
a blotchy texture can be described as uneven and irregular with patches of different colors or shades.
stained: a stained texture typically appears as a dull or opaque discoloration on the surface of a material that has been heavily soiled or contaminated.
a stained texture is often visible as a dark or murky color in an otherwise white or light-colored fabric or material.
crystalline: crystalline texture is often described as transparent and delicate.
crystalline texture resembles a finely polished gemstone with intricate patterns of tiny lines and inclusions.
porous: a porous texture is one that allows liquids to pass through it easily and freely.
porous materials have many small holes throughout their surface.
banded: a banded surface appears as a repeating pattern of different colors often seen in rocks and minerals.
a banded texture is a pattern with repeating stripes in the same color that appear in a grid pattern on a surface.
lacelike: a lacelike surface has a smooth and shiny appearance with tiny imperfections that resemble a woven fabric pattern.

a lacelike surface is typically characterized by a smooth and shiny appearance that is created through the use of a thin layer of fabric or textile that is woven in a specific pattern or texture that catches the light.
sprinkled: sprinkled material appears as a loose collection of small particles, such as sugar, salt, or other powders, that have been distributed evenly over a surface.
sprinkled material is small white flakes or powdery debris scattered over the surface of a liquid.
bubbly: a bubbly texture is often associated with light, airy, and slightly effervescent materials like cotton or egg whites that give them a puffy or mousse-like appearance and a soft, delicate feel.
bubbly material has a clear appearance.
lined: linen material is typically made from cotton or linen fabric, often with a smooth and soft texture.
a lined surface is a flat piece of paper with a smooth edge that is divided into straight lines.
veined: a veined surface is characterized by small dark lines or streaks on a pale background.
veined material often appears as a combination of dark and light colors on a surface with an irregular pattern of fine lines and streaks of contrasting colors.
bumpy: bumpy material appears as rough unevenly textured surface.
a bumpy surface is rough and uneven in texture.
paisley: paisley texture is a pattern of repeating circular or irregular shapes in a random or irregular order often used in fabrics.
paisley patterns often feature floral or geometric motifs in a repetitive way across fabric.'
potholed: potholed material has irregular and uneven patterns with deep grooves and ridges that make it difficult to walk on.
a potholed texture appears as an irregularly patterned and often rough surface.
waffled: the material is typically a crumbly or fragile texture due to its high moisture content.
a waffled texture has a soft, uneven, and slightly rough appearance, resembling a roughened surface, often with small cracks or fissures.
pitted: a pitted surface is often characterized by deep holes and grooves that have been caused by wear and tear over time.
a pitted texture is characterized by deep holes or cavities in the surface of the object.
frilly: a frilly surface is a gentle texture that is soft and slightly shiny and smooth to the touch.
a frilly surface is a gentle texture that is soft and slightly shiny and smooth to the touch.
spiralled: spiralled material appears to have a hollow interior with layers of concentric spirals forming a curved surface.
a spiralled surface is a curved or twisted surface.
knitted: a knitted surface is a thick and dense fabric made from interconnected loops of yarn
a knitted texture is a thick and dense pattern made from loops of yarn.
grooved: a grooved surface typically has parallel grooves or ridges on it that are often caused by wear and tear from heavy use.
grooved material is typically found with cut edges and patterns of irregular shapes on the surface.
dotted: a dotted surface is a flat piece of material with small raised lines or dots on it that appear when you touch it gently.
a dotted texture is similar to a raised grid with small dots spaced evenly apart in a straight line along the surface of an object.
interlaced: interlaced material appears as a mix of different colors and textures intertwined together seamlessly together effectively.
interlaced material is layered or woven together in a complex pattern.
crosshatched: crosshatched material is often made from a combination of colored threads or fibers, such as cotton or polyester, which are woven together in a specific pattern to create a decorative design.
a crosshatched surface is a pattern of intersecting lines with dots in between.
wrinkled: wrinkled material is typically made from a fabric that is prone to sagging or gathering when stretched.
a wrinkled texture is a bumpy and uneven appearance.
smeared: a smeared surface can be described as one that has an uneven or marred appearance due to the spreading or spreading out of some substance onto the surface it has previously come into contact with.
smeared material resembles a mixture of colors.
striped: striped material appears as alternating bands of solid color often with a slightly textured surface.
a striped texture is a pattern of two or more contrasting colors or shades that run parallel to each other.
braided: braided materials often have intertwined strands of various thicknesses and textures that give them a unique appearance and tactile quality.
a braided surface is typically formed by interlacing threads of yarn or string into a rope-like shape.
freckled: freckled material typically appears as a collection of rough, unevenly textured particles that cover a surface in patches of varying color.
a freckled surface has a patchy and uneven texture with small dots of color like freckles scattered randomly across it.
cobwebbed: a cobwebbed surface is typically covered with a thick layer of dust and debris.
a cobwebbed texture is formed when small particles are stuck to the surface of a fabric, resulting in a dusty or speckled appearance.
honeycombed: honeycombed material is typically found in beehives and consists of a solid outer layer covered with small gaps and holes that allow for the escape of air and insects and the entry of honey and other food particles.
honeycombed concrete is characterized by a network of small, irregular cells.
woven: a woven surface is typically made from fibers intertwined to form a fabric pattern that has a natural texture and appearance.
a woven surface is typically created by interlacing threads or fibers in a repetitive pattern.
matted: matting material appears as uneven or rough-textured fabric or carpeting in nature.
a matted surface appears as a tangled and messy collection of fur and hair all over a particular area of an animal's skin
zigzagged: zigzagged material resembles a series of curved lines often found on fabrics or objects that have undergone a change in texture.
a zigzagged texture is characterized by repeated alternating patterns of lines and curves.
marbled: marbled material is usually found in colored paper products and consists of streaks of different colors that mix together to create a unique pattern.
marbled material is often found in rocks or paints in the form of streaks or patches of different colors.
studded: soft and shiny pieces of material can be found on dolls or toys sometimes.
a studded texture is a pattern of small projections or indentations on the surface of an object that resembles the appearance of a studded leather belt or rough, rocky terrain.
grid: a grid texture is a pattern of lines or bars that are superimposed on a surface to create a three-dimensional effect on a two-dimensional image.

a grid texture is created by breaking the image into horizontal or vertical grid lines and displaying each line in a specific color.
